title: EMEA Product Manager, Germany
content:
Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies—from the world’s largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups—use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone’s reach while doing the most important work of your career.
 
About the team:
At Stripe, product development is an extremely collaborative effort between engineering, design, analytics, partnerships, legal, risk and go-to-market teams. You’d be joining a group of experienced Product Managers who have a track record of successfully building large-scale business and products that are collectively impacting millions of users around the world.
 
In EMEA, the team is responsible for ensuring all of Stripe’s products across payments, revenue management, banking as a service, etc. best fit the unique needs of each country, expanding and innovating on the platform in markets throughout the region. We are looking for a Product Manager who’s passionate about building a winning strategy to solve the complex payments landscape, building new payment methods & flows, and improving our overall local user experience, across marketing, local data requirements, taxes, payout timings, and more in Germany, while  scaling solutions across EMEA. We need a Product Manager who understands and empathizes with German users and is driven to improve their business needs beyond payments. You’ll get to work with central engineering teams both in the region in Europe as well as across our other global offices to build delightful features that span various parts of the system, as well as working with our business, sales and operations teams to understand and solve our users’ pain points.
 
In this role, you will:

Be a well-rounded product leader -- someone who has both excellent product design/UX sense and strengths in market dynamics and business strategy. 
Set the long-term product strategy for our products and platforms in your key markets.
Be accountable for users, partners, regulators, and Stripe’s business performance in the region by collaborating with many stakeholder and partner teams across the company.
Be an evangelist for German users and their needs inside and outside of Stripe to build global solutions. 

 
We are looking for someone who has:

Experience building and driving international product strategy and execution with 10+ years of experience in a product role.
Experience in the payments industry especially or other fintech domains.
You are passionate about leading cross functional teams, and creating a strong identity and culture.
Built products by collaborating across engineering, analytics, marketing, design and other key stakeholders.
Approached product management from a user’s vantage point and is motivated by the chance to improve the lives of customers.
Strategic vision of where Germany and the EMEA region is heading, and where technology and financial services fit into that puzzle.
Experience managing technical software products from kick-off to ship.
Strong written and verbal communication skills in German and English with a precise talent for articulating customer challenges.

questions.label: Please select the country where you currently reside.
Please select the country or countries you anticipate working in for the role in which you are applying.
Are you authorized to work in the location(s) you selected in your previous response?
Will you require Stripe to sponsor you for a work permit now or in the future for the location(s) you selected in in your previous response?

questions.description: Stripe is currently operating in a hybrid work environment. In-office expectations for office-assigned Stripes vary by team. A remote location, in most cases, is defined as living 50 miles or more from an office location. While you would be welcome to join the office for team or business meetings when necessary, the expectation would be that you would regularly work from home rather than a Stripe office location. Stripe offices are located in Amsterdam, Bangkok, Bengaluru, Berlin, Chicago, Dubai, Dublin, Jakarta, London, Madrid, Mexico City, New York City, Paris, São Paulo, Singapore, South San Francisco, Seattle, Tokyo, and Toronto. Stripe does not cover the cost of relocating to a remote location. We encourage you to apply for roles that match the location in which you live or have intentions to live.
questions.label: If this role offers the option to work from a remote location, do you plan to work remotely?

values.label: Yes, I intend to work remotely.
No, I intend to work from an office location.

questions.label: Do you have full professional written and verbal proficiency in German and English?
